Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Hope you are all doing well :) i had my first Chemo today it was nerve wracking but i got through it and i am home. Im not feeling great pretty crap to be exact i have such a sore head feel like its going to blow off my shoulders and i have been sick i have my anti sickness meds...................can i take something for my sore head ie paracetamol?  i am hoping i feel better soon :) Mx
Posts.Title: Had my first chemo today

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Hope everyone is doing ok :) i was feeling ok till a few days ago now i have terrible tummy problems i have been suffering from really bad heart burn was up at 3am this morn as it was unbearable!  i do have a bowel problem so the chemo has inflamed that prob but its the heartburn thats the worst and its really dragging me down as it is just making me feel awful as im not sleeping :( At the moment i was already taking Omeprazole and i saw my GP yesterday and got Gaviscon which seemed to help but isnt really helping today...............does anyone have any suggestions anything else i can do? it actually hurts to eat :( Mx
Posts.Title: Terrible tummy :(

Posts.Content: Well i made it 12 and a bit days after my first chemo........my hair is coming out with a vengeance! so i am shaving it t/ow! i was absolutely fine and then yesterday the top of my head was a little sore and i was able to pull some hair out.....and then today it has spread to the back of my head and the front..............cancer has taken enough of me it is NOT getting my hair.......so i am shaving it off! :) Mx
Posts.Title: My hair has finally decided to leave the building!

Posts.Content: Good luck for starting chemo :) yip shave it off at least we can control that part of what we are going through! :) Mx

Posts.Title: Prosthetic boobs :)

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I hope you all had a good weekend its now officially summer time! i live in Scotland and all it has done is rain!!! lol no surprise there! Thanks for all your lovely messages of support i was struggling with my first chemo due in a few days i have still been teary but i am doing ok. I just seem to be having such a problem with preparing myself for  my first chemo? i did so well with my mastectomy? i say to people its not like they will be pumping marshmallows and rainbows into me! lol I am also unsure what to do with my hair....i know its probably a given i will lose my hair i will be getting FEC chemo x6. I would shave it off now but my partner/family /friends tel me to wait.....just to see if it actually does fall out? so i am unsure what to do? i can totally shave it off without a problem i was just wondering what everyone else did or thought? Mx
Posts.Title: First chemo in a few days

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, I hope everyone is doing well I wanted to ask the community if they know of any vitamins or natural treatments for Neuropathy? I completed my treatment last Nov i had FEC x 6 and 20 x Radiotherapy i didnt have the T part of FEC. It is very rare to have Neuropathy on just FEC so trust me to be a rarity! lol i saw my Oncologist the other day and i asked her in the years she has been an Oncologist (she has been doing it for prob 20yrs!)  has she seen this before and she replied....No! to which i burst out laughing lol i couldnt help it. I had a terrible time on FEC made me really ill and my neuropathy started half way through but it wasn't bad. When i completed my treatment my hair grew back in and at the start of this year promptly fell out again! again doesn't usually happen and my eyebrows didn't really grow back so i got semi permanent makeup which actually look nicer than mines ever did so happy with that lol. My Neuropathy is really bad i have lost the feeling in both feet.....thats actually a contradiction as i feel awful pain in them! I have also developed a dropped left foot so i cant walk without a stick because of that and my balance is really bad I have also lost nearly all the feeling in my hands so my grip isnt very good. At the moment my GP who has been fab has tried a few things at the moment we are trying Gabapentin so we will see how that goes!  I just wanted to ask the community of any treatments advice etc? I want to add as well to anyone who is on FEC at the moment and is reading this dont panic! it is VERY rare to have the problems i have because of FEC so dont worry! and if you do have any funny feelings in your hands or feet tell your nurse/oncs doctors straight away! Mines started as a minor vibration in my right foot. Big hugs  Mx
Posts.Title: Peripheral Neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hi Puzzler yeah and they where fine. Mx
Posts.Title: Peripheral Neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hi Kargus, Its awful it was definitely my chemo as it started mid way through treatment in my right foot a feeling of vibration or as i explained it to my chemo nurse i had a cat in my foot purring lol. At the time it wasn't bad but i have gradually got worse since completing treatment and i am now unable to walk unaided  and my grip is getting worse in my hands. I hope your GP can help Mx
Posts.Title: Peripheral Neuropathy

Posts.Content: Thanks Jacqueline yeah its a big pair of granny pants thats for sure! no offence to grandmothers lol xx

Mx
